se.lypson.common.thread
Interface IThreadObserver

public interface IThreadObserver

This interface is part of the Observer Pattern functionality added to the Thread class. Implementors of this interface can be notified when a thread sends messages and when it finishes.

Author:
Tobias Persson

Method Summary
 void threadFinishedEvent(Thread thread)
          The event handler that will be called when an observed Thread object finishes.
 void threadMessageEvent(Thread thread, java.lang.Object message)
           The event handler that will be called when an observed Thread object sends a message.
 

Method Detail

threadMessageEvent

void threadMessageEvent(Thread thread,
                        java.lang.Object message)

The event handler that will be called when an observed Thread object sends a message.

The general contract for this method specifies that the message must not be changed by observers - there could be multiple observers of the thread and all should receive the same message.

Parameters:
thread - the Thread object that generated the event by finishing.
message - the message the thread sent. The message should not be changed by observers.

threadFinishedEvent

void threadFinishedEvent(Thread thread)
The event handler that will be called when an observed Thread object finishes.

Parameters:
thread - the Thread object that generated the event by finishing.
